availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Foster (Cincinnati, Ohio, Stone Cutter and Master of Stone Works. )

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, Stone Cutter and Master of Stone Works. Native of England. Married to Louisia Jane Coleman Foster. Father of William B. Foster, Anna Foster, Ida Foster, Joseph Foster, Robert L. Foster, Jennie L. Foster and Williard S. Foster. Stone cutter in Cincinnati in 1850. Master of Stone Works in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Sarah A. Thilman as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 7, p. 289B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 7, p. 113.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 7, p. 94B.
"Foster, Jennie L.," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 27640.
"Deaths," The Cincinnati Post (Cincinnati, Oh), September 15, 1902, p. 9.
